turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: No, you?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Hunh-uh.  Check the bread.  He spreads it like the Russians are in Jersey.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: He probably sells insurance.  Owns a chicken farm in Hackensack.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Whatta you say we wait and give him a tail?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Give who a tail?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: The greaser with the blonde.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: What for -- you wanna play Hide the Salami with his old lady?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Come on -- just for fun --

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Monica?  Who's Monica?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: A and A, that's all you're interested in -- Arrests and Ass.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: If that's not a drop or a pickup, I'll open a charge for you at Bloomingdale's.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Make it Alexander's, I like the toy department.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Toy wit' this will ya.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: There's about a hundred years' parole time in there night or day.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I think we oughta burn him on suspicion.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Suspicion of what?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Makin' wine in the basement.  He looks like that wop stooge used to drive for the Fracisi brothers.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: No sir -- this is where Joel lives.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: He was the bank on that shipment outta Mexico three years ago.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What the hell am I drivin' for? I'm a first grade Detective. You're a second grade guinea.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: I'm wounded.  Oh, oh.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I'm goin' check on this address in the Bronx, if you're bullshitting me, it's your ass.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Tell everybody we'll be back in an hour.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: We're goin' now!  Goodbye.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: We got information that there's no shit in the street -- it's like a desert full of junkies with a big score coming in to make everybody well.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: This could be it, Walter.  This Candy Store guy, putting on a big show in a fancy nightclub with known connections all over him. Then on our own, after working the whole day and night, we tail him out to Brooklyn and sit on him for a week practically, and who do we come up with?  Joel Weinstock.  You gotta let us have it.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Popeye.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: It's Cloudy.  Open the door.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Let yourself in.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: What happened to you?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: The crazy kid handcuffed me to the bed.  With my own cuffs.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: You got the warrant?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: We also got Bill Mulderig and Phil Klein.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Throw 'em in the bathroom, will you? How good are the warrants?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Sixty days.  Here.  Don't mention it.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: You want the red or the white?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Pour it in your ear.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: The guy's a frog -- I'm pretty sure. Also he made me.  Stayin' on four but went up to six -- cute.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: The other guy's a frog too.  Checked in at the Edison.  Had a hooker sent up.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What about Sal?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: We put him to bed for the night.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: This fella Nicoli's got a record in France, Walter.  He's wanted for questioning in the murder of a French cop.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I say we keep sittin' on Boca.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: My ass.  The only reason you're in this is because you've got a big expense account for buying junk and you like to see your picture in the papers.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: This is my case.  Get these guys off my back and let me handle it.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Timezit?

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Four.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Same car.

turns.speaker: RUSSO
turns.text: Third time around.

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: Hey, Bo.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Hiya, Jesus.

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: Can you use a new suit for Christmans?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Whatta you got?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Where'd you get this fag shit?

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: This is what the tough guys are wearin'.  You know I only steal from the best.  It's Bonwit Teller.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Pass.

turns.speaker: JESUS
turns.text: Forty dollars -- was $250.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Whyn't you get it dry cleaned and burned.

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: There are four auto graveyards like this one in the other boroughs, handling about a thousand vehicles a month.  Those that aren't claimed are auctioned here once a month.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Just for mistakes of parking?

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: No.  Many are involved in crimes and confiscated... or just abandoned. This is, as you know, your prime source of scrap metal, M. Charnier.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Darling, may I have this one?

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: Two railroads as part of a connecting railway which provided passage from New England to the South.  It was actually the first railroad through New York City.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: Why is it called Hellgate?

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: The river at this point is the most dangerous on the East Coast.  Years ago, hundreds of ships went down here.

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: I'm afraid the rest of Ward's Island isn't nearly as romantic - a pollution plant, a hospital, a training school for garbage men and that area over there, where the old cars are kept, prior to being processed for shipment to, among other places, The Charnier Shipping Company, of Marseilles, France.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What is that old building?

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: Oh, it's been abandoned for years.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: It was a crematorium.

turns.speaker: MARIE
turns.text: For garbage?

turns.speaker: LA VALLE
turns.text: For dead bodies.

turns.speaker: WEINSTOCK
turns.text: What am I, a shmuck?  What's the hurry?  He could see a couple of shows and visit the top of the Empire State Building.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Joel, don't jerk me.  I spent a lot o' time settin' this one up.

turns.speaker: WEINSTOCK
turns.text: So whatta you want a badge?  It's your first major league game Sal. One thing I learned, move calmly, move cautiously.  You'll never be sorry.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I been damn careful up to now.

turns.speaker: WEINSTOCK
turns.text: Which is why your phone lines are tapped and the Feds are crawlin' all over you like flies.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I'm straight, Joel.  They haven't got shit on me.  Look, I'm tellin' you, he'll take the deal somewhere else.

turns.speaker: WEINSTOCK
turns.text: He could go someplace else with his sixty kilos of heroin and see how easy it is to pull together a half million cash.  He wouldn't find there was any hurry to do this kind of business.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: That was over thirty years ago.  I paid for that and then some.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You go to Xavier High School, Daryl?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You remember Mary Finelli?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You know what I'm saying.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Well, I think you do.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Sexual assault, Daryl.  Five years.  But you got lucky, right?  You got away with something else.  Something you figured nobody knows about.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: What I know is what I told you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Let me tell you what I know, Daryl.  You went to Saint Xavier with Mary.  You lived five blocks from her.  You liked her.  But she ain't interested.  That must've hurt, huh?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: So, what'd you do about it, Daryl?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Oh, my God!  What is that?!  Why you showing me this shit!?  JESUS!  JESUS! Get those away from me!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nicky Moore.  Patty Ryan.  Mary Finelli. These names mean anything to you, asshole?  Julia Sullivan!  She mean anything?  She means something to me!

turns.speaker: SHEPARD
turns.text: You got a collar in here for the Nightingale murders?

turns.speaker: DESK SGT.
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SHEPARD
turns.text: I'm working with one of the victims outta Brooklyn North.  You mind I take a shot at him?

turns.speaker: DESK SGT.
turns.text: That's Deleon and Hayes' collar.

turns.speaker: SHEPARD
turns.text: They around?

turns.speaker: DESK SGT.
turns.text: Just missed Deleon.  Hayes is up in the squad.

turns.speaker: SHEPARD
turns.text: Where's the collar, in the cells?

turns.speaker: DESK SGT.
turns.text: No, I think he's up in interrogation.

turns.speaker: SHEPARD
turns.text: I'll go find Hayes.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Why haven't they killed the juice?

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Switches are shorted out.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You're shitting me!

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: Wish I was.  Oldest part of the system down there.  We're on it, but it's gonna take awhile.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: We gotta go underground.  Get those guys out, now.

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: We tried.  Bulkhead door's rusted shut. Won't budge.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: How do we get to the vault door?

turns.speaker: SUPERVISOR
turns.text: There's a manhole at Canal and Bowery.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Oh, man.  Hope it ain't like this in Baltimore tomorrow.

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: Baltimore?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The game, Graham.  The Series?

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: Oh, yeah.  Damn.  My watch is busted.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey, Rookie.  Be cool.  Just stay with me.  This is what we do.

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: I seem nervous, huh?

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: Frank.  We gotta go back.  Frank...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Stay with me, Gib.  We're gonna do this.

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: I should'a been a fucking mailman.

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: Frank.  Hey, man.  You alright?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm alright, Gibby.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It looks open on the other side.

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: Don't know what's behind it.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: One way to find out.

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: Gotta be another way up, Frank.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Then fuckin' find it.  I'm going for the girl.

turns.speaker: GIBSON
turns.text: You okay, man?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Elvis has left the building.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey, bud.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Hey, bud.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: How about a little of the King?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Well, why not a little of the King?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Damn.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You alright?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I think I ruined the sauce...again.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What's the matter, Jules?  Trouble workin' an eight hour shift, watching the kid and whipping up a little bolognese?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: You didn't marry Donna Reed.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'd go with you and Chinese take-out over her any time.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: How was your tour?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The usual.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Butch called.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Did he?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: He did.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It was under control, Bud.  Butchy's just getting tight in his old age.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Nothing wrong with old age, Frank...long as you get there.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Frankie, Johnny wants to say goodnight.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Frank...what's wrong?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Nothing.  I just wanted to see you.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Where's Johnny?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I tucked him in at Gordo's.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: You give him his drops?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: One in each ear.  What would you do without me?

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Probably marry some rich doctor and never have to work...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I love you, Bud.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I love you more.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Boy is he excited about the game tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: He ain't the only one.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I'm off.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Wish you weren't.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Do you know how much I love you?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: There's something I gotta take care of. Something I need to tell you about.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Okay...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I've been talking to this...guy...this cop...on the HAM...and, uh, he...

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Honey, what is it?  Just tell me.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I've been talking to Johnny...on the radio.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I know.  He loves that thing.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No.  Not our Johnny.  I mean, it's Johnny...but not now...in the future.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: I'll be upstairs...if you want to play.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm serious.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: So am I.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Jules, I want you to say hello to somebody...  I'm on with John - that guy I told you about.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: The future guy?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah, but, no kidding around, he's a good guy, a real good guy...

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Then you gotta hide it somewhere. Somewhere where nobody's gonna find it...for 29 years!  Put it under the loose floorboard by the window!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I gotcha, I gotcha Chief!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey, bud.

turns.speaker: JULIA
turns.text: Frank...

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Lucky throw, fire boy.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Luck, my ass.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Okay, I'm on it.  Hey.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Hello, Frank.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Frank, we need to talk...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: John, hold on a second.  I'm in the middle of something important here.  You mind if...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Satch, you gotta just give me...Satch is here John.  You hear me?  Satch is here.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: I'm sorry, Frank, but you need to come outside.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What is going on here, Satch?  What are those guys doing out there?

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: I think you know, Frank.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No, I don't.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Let's go outside and talk.  We need to do that.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Let's go.  Do us both a favor.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Do you know where I found this?

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: 415 Greenwich St.  #302.  Under the body of a murdered woman.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No.  This isn't what you think.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: I wanna be wrong here.  But we need to go to the precinct and talk about it.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Okay, okay.  I need to go say something to Julia and finish up with the guy on the radio.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: You can talk to Julia.  Forget the radio.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I swear, Satch.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Uh, huh...  Uh, huh.  And you got this from the guy you were talking to on the radio when I came in?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: As nuts as that sounds, yes.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Uh, huh.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Satch, would you listen to me here.  Just you and me.  Can I talk to you here, alone?

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Frank, this is not the time to be worried about covering up if you had a thing with this girl.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: He's not gonna stop, Satch.  He's gonna keep on...

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Are you listening to me?  You're in a world of shit.  An eye witness has you outside the dead girl's apartment.  We got your prints all over the place.  Plus the fucking driver's license, Frank.  You gotta give me something here. Something I can believe.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What if I could prove it to you, Satch?

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: How's that?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What if I told you that in the bottom of the 6th we're gonna be down 3-0.  And Cleon Jones is gonna get hit in the foot. It's gonna leave a scuff mark on the ball.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Frank, please...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The next batter, Clendenon, hits one outta the park.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Frank, this is insane...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: In the bottom of the 7th, Weis is gonna hit a solo home run.  Jones and Swoboda are gonna score in the 8th.  The Mets are gonna win 5-3.  Go watch the game, Satch.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Go watch the game?  Go watch the fucking game?  Frank, they're gonna make you for Sissy Clark's murderer.  It matches the Nightingale's profile.  You understand what that means?

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Deleon.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Satch, you gotta listen to me...

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Frank.  We know.  We know it's Shepard.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No kidding.  I'm on the corner of 65th and CPW.  Come get me.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: You missed a hell of a game, Frank.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Next time lets put some money on it.

turns.speaker: SATCH
turns.text: Get him home safe.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Looks like two weeks worth of allowance, Chief.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I know.  Sorry, Dad.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Glad to hear that.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Okay, start pedaling.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Daddy put the wheels back on.  I'm gonna fall.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Don't think about falling, just keep pedaling.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Daddy, I'm scared.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: C'mon, Chief, show some guts.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Daddy, come up and sing the baseball.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'll be up soon, Little Chief.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I'm scared.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Don't be scared.  This time I'm right behind you if you fall.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Daddy, Daddy, I can't.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No, but we can.  We can do it together. Spirit and guts, Chief.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You ready?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Wait...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm right here behind you...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yes!  That's it!  You got it, you got it! Way to go, Chief!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I'm doing it!  I'm doing it!

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Uh, hello?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: WB2YKXB, who've I got?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Name's John.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Are you licensed to broadcast, buddy?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Look, I don't really remember how this thing works.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Listen, you can't broadcast without a license.  Unless this is an emergency, you gotta get off the band.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Pal, my whole life's an emergency.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Where are you transmitting from?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Queens, New York.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Whatta ya know.  Bayside, born and raised.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I thought these things were for talkin' around the world.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: 15-band closes down at night.  During the day you can chew the band with China if you want.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I can't believe people are still using these things.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Sorry 'bout that.  So Queens, you psyched for the Series?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't really follow baseball anymore.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I got fed up with all the bullshit.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Fed up?  Lemme tell you something, in a 1000 years, when school kids study America, they're gonna learn about three things: the Constitution, Rock 'n' Roll, and Baseball.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm right with you, man.  He's got the heart of a lion.  Hey, how 'bout the first game of the Series?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah.  It was all over after Buford nailed Seaver's first pitch outta the park.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: ...WB2YXB calling unidentified station, Queens.  CQ 15.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I been Q-ing you all night.  How the hell did you do it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: The World Series.  You called Buford's homer.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wasn't too tough, buddy.  Game happened almost thirty years ago.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What are you talking about?  I'm talking about this afternoon.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: This afternoon?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Sorry 'bout that.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What'd you just say?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Oh, that was my kid.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You call your son Little Chief?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Uh huh...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What'd you say your name was?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Frank...Frank Sullivan.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Is this some kind of joke?  Gordo is that you?  Are you fucking with me?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Look pal, I'm just askin' how you...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You're telling me your name is Frank Sullivan, you live in Queens and you just saw the first game of the '69 Series...live?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Right...and I'm asking how you called the game.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Gordo, if this is you, so help me...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What the hell does Gordy have to do with it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What'd you say your station...uh, your call letters were?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Now you listen to me.  My name is John Francis Sullivan, I live at 1060 41st, where I've lived my whole life.  And I saw the first game of the '69 Series at my Uncle Butch's house with my father...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: 29-years ago.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: 29 years...?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: My dad's name was Frank Patrick Sullivan, he was a fire fighter and a die-hard Mets fan.  And every night when I went to bed he sang to me...  Take me out to the ball game, take me out with the crowd...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What the hell...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm dreaming this.  Shit, this is a dream.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm not dreaming.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Nothing...I just spilled something.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Oh my god.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: You just burned the desk.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What's happening?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: That's impossible.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What if it's not...

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Dad...?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Johnny...?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: How could this be happening?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: We gotta be bouncing off the mother sun spot of all time.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Sun spot?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah, that's how Hams work.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Wait a sec...there was something on the news.  Something about this space anomaly.  I think they said it was connected to some storm in '69.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You sound...ground up...?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm thirty-five years old.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Thirty-five?  That would make it...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: 1998...?  This is wrong.  Who are you? Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm not doing anything.  Look, I don't know what's going on.  But I swear on my life, I"m here at your old desk, on your Ham, in our house, right now...in 1998.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It's really you, isn't it?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Yeah...I think so.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No, not yet.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Too busy playin' ball, huh?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Nah, I gave it up.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You're still my Little Chief, right?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm trying to be, Dad.  I'm tyrin'.  It's good to hear your voice.  I missed you...so much.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I think I'm losing you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No wait, don't go!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It's okay.  I'm still here, Chief.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: But you're not...you're not still here.
